description: Erection of single storey side extension (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Development)
decision_conditions: The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph A.1(e)(ii), Class A, Part 1, Schedule 2, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the proposed single storey side extension would extend beyond a wall which fronts a highway and forms a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph A.1(i), Class A, Part 1, Schedule 2, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the submitted drawings are not to scale, which means that insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate that the proposed single storey side extension would not be within 2 metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse and have an eaves height that would exceed 3 metres.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph A.1(j)(i)(iii), Class A, Part 1, Schedule 2, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the submitted drawings are not to scale, which means that insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate that the proposed single storey side extension would not exceed 4 metres in height or have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse.
